item.title: Various Routing & Packet Forwarding Techniques
item.description: Table of contents Bridging and Routing L2 Forwarding L3 Forwarding VRF Overlays 1. IP in IP 2. GRE 3. VXLAN Segment Routing Forwarding in NIC The core routing and packet forwarding haven’t changed for decades and it is not going to change for next decade also. But, it is going to evolve due to market needs, specially data centres. At the same time, Silicon capacity, CPU power, NIC bandwidth, all have increased significantly.
